meanings.definition: Lacking sparks or the ability to produce sparks.
meanings.sent1: The old, worn-out battery was completely sparkless.
meanings.sent2: The damp wood was so sparkless that it wouldn't light up.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand was sparkless, making his tricks fall flat.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were sparkless, devoid of any hint of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned factory stood silent and sparkless, a shadow of its former self.

meanings.sent1: The rainy day left the playground sparkless and empty.
meanings.sent2: His sparkless performance failed to captivate the audience.
meanings.sent3: The party was sparkless until the clown arrived with his antics.
meanings.sent4: The sparkless atmosphere in the office made the employees feel dull.
meanings.sent5: The sparkless conversation left them both feeling bored and uninterested.
